sokochan.GridObjects

Class TileGridObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • sokochan.GridObjects.GridObject
      • sokochan.GridObjects.TileGridObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tile, Wall 

    public abstract class TileGridObject
extends GridObject
    An abstract class for a tile, i.e. an object that is directly part of the TileGridObject in the SokochanGrid.

    May contain a reference to the object placed on the tile, or null if its empty.

    Created by Vittorio on 12-Oct-16.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the object placed on the current tile.

      Checks if a TileGridObject is walkable.

    • Method Detail

      • isWalkable

        public boolean isWalkable()
        Checks if a TileGridObject is walkable.

        A tile is walkable if:

        • Is not a Wall
        • It's inside the grid boundaries
        • Has no MovableGridObject on top of it
        Returns:
        false if out of bound or non walkable or true if walkable, i.e. an empty tile

      • getPlacedObject

        public MovableGridObject getPlacedObject()
        Returns the object placed on the current tile. May be null if it is empty
        Returns:
        the object | null if empty

      • setPlacedObject

        public boolean setPlacedObject(MovableGridObject object)
        Will attempt to place an object to a tile. It will fail if the tile has already something or is non-walkable.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to place
        Returns:
        true if successfully placed | false if the tile is not free

      • place

        protected void place()
        Description copied from class: GridObject
        Children class are responsible to place themselves on the grid, either as a tile or an object placed on it
        Specified by:
        place in class GridObject
